headline: Toshiba and GE Vernova Sign MoU to advance carbon reduction and efficiency for gas turbine fired power plants in Japan and other parts of Asia
summary: Toshiba Energy Systems & Solutions Corporation (Toshiba) and GE Vernova (NYSE: GEV) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to work together on an integrated Gas Turbine Combined Cycle (GTCC) CCS solution to reduce power plant CO2 emissions. The solution will combine GE Vernova's Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) system with Toshiba's carbon capture solution, which utilizes Toshiba's proprietary solvent. This initiative is related to the recently created focus group between the Japan's Min

content.summary: Toshiba Energy Systems & Solutions Corporation (Toshiba) and GE Vernova (NYSE: GEV) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to work together on an integrated Gas Turbine Combined Cycle (GTCC) CCS solution to reduce power plant CO2 emissions. The solution will combine GE Vernova's Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) system with Toshiba's carbon capture solution, which utilizes Toshiba's proprietary solvent. This initiative is related to the recently created focus group between the Japan's Min

thumbnail.caption: The MoU signing ceremony, in Kawasaki, Japan. November 6, 2025; Front row from left: Mr. Jeremee Wetherby of GE Vernova, Mr. Kensuke Suzuki, Head of New Technology of Toshiba’s Power Systems Division; Back row: Mr. Shinichi Kihara of METI’s Director-General for Energy and Environmental Policy

headline: GE Vernova (GEV): A Fresh Look at Valuation After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: GE Vernova (GEV) has caught the eye of investors recently, as shifting market dynamics have influenced its stock performance. Steady revenue and improving annual net income growth provide an interesting backdrop for ongoing valuation discussions. See our latest analysis for GE Vernova. After staging a considerable rally earlier in the year, GE Vernova’s share price has cooled recently with a 7.21% dip over the past month. Its year-to-date share price return still sits at an impressive 65.13%...
